solution_line_template: Hector gave to Alisha twice as many as he had given Todd, for a total of {todd_gumballs}*{alisha_multiplier}=<<{todd_gumballs}*{alisha_multiplier}={alisha_gumballs}>>{alisha_gumballs} gumballs,

Hector gave 5 less than four times as many to Bobby as he had given to Alisha, or a total of ({alisha_gumballs}*{bobby_multiplier})-{bobby_less}=<<{alisha_gumballs}*{bobby_multiplier}-{bobby_less}={bobby_gumballs}>>{bobby_gumballs} gumballs.

If Hector had {remaining_gumballs} gumballs remaining, he originally purchased {todd_gumballs}+{alisha_gumballs}+{bobby_gumballs}+{remaining_gumballs}=<<{todd_gumballs}+{alisha_gumballs}+{bobby_gumballs}+{remaining_gumballs}={total_gumballs}>>{total_gumballs} gumballs.
